Reviews.Title: Nice computer for Windows 7 users
Reviews.Author: yogo "yogo"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this computer , because I had a windows 8 computer that was confusing to use.This laptop has a nice keyboard that is quiet, and the keys are smooth. The screen is brightwith a sharp picture. The thing I like most, is the card reader works with xd memory cards. I havea Fuji Film camera that uses this card. Windows 8 does not work for me. I was happy to find this laptop.I am going to hold on to it as long as I can.

Reviews.Title: Bought this laptop for Windows 7 operating system
Reviews.Author: Karen R
Reviews.Content: You can buy the same computer with Windows 8 for considerably less.  There is a reason why.  Microsoft 8 is killing the PC market.  I bought an HP laptop with Windows 8 several months ago and it is a horror.  I hate the computer.  I have researched and Windows 8.1 does not appear to be much better and it is not even available yet.  And so I just ordered 2 of these laptops to get Windows 7 while they are still available. It is difficult to find them in stores.  My software is not compatible with Windows 8, many files do not work, my scanner did not work, my printer is agonizingly slow.  It is a HORROR. Microsoft should recall all of the Windows 8 computers it sold.

Reviews.Title: Mostly very pleased
Reviews.Author: Cas Walker
Reviews.Content: I'm mostly very pleased with this laptop. The big screen and the performance are great.The big 17.3 inch screen comes at a price for portability. It weighs 7 pounds. That's a bit much to carry in my hand or on one shoulder but not as bad in a backpack. I've been using a backpack on little luggage cart. That may seem like a lot of bother but I really like this big screen.This past week I tried to use my USB3 Toshiba 1 TB portable hard drive on each of the USB3 ports. But it kept disconnecting & reconnecting making it unusable. I tested other USB3 portable drives and had the same spontaneous disconnect problem. These drives work fine on the USB3 ports of my Win8 Samsung laptop & my Win7 Dell desktop. These portable USB3 drives get power from the USB3 port.Acer recommended reinstalling the USB3 driver and that fixed things for 3 of my 4 USB3 portable drives. But not the Toshiba 1TB drive, it still disconnected occasionally.From Googling I found the disconnecting problem is common & vexing with USB3 portable drives on a lot of Win 7 & Win 8 computers. I tried turning off Win7's USB power control but it didn't help. Both my portable drives work fine on the Acer's USB2 ports but not at USB3 speed.I read that the disconnecting problem might be due to the drives starving for power so I ordered a HooToo USB3 hub with its own power supply. That fixed it, the Toshiba USB3 drive now works reliably.I hope other reviewers will comment on their experiences using portable USB3 hard drives on the Acer's USB3 ports.==================On 11 July I commented on someone else's review:I just got mine and had to check on your comment about the one RAM slot. I took off the bottom cover and found one slot with a 4GB SODIMM, and a separate second RAM slot that's empty. I expected it to have two 2GB RAM sticks. Having just one 4GB stick and an empty slot is much better because upgrading only required buying one stick. Alas upgrading to 8GB didn't noticeably change performance. It was already doing fine with 4GB. If you do upgrade RAM use CPU-Z to check the specs of the supplied 4GB stick. I had to look around to find another that matched it. I bought CORSAIR Vengeance 4GB PC3 12800, Model CMSX4GX3M1A1600C9 and that works. It has the same high performance as the original RAM.I was shocked to find this laptop has an empty bay for a second hard drive. There's no "caddy" to secure a second drive inside the bay but having the space and the SATA+power ports is very cool. (I found the caddy for $30 w/shipping at itec4less.com)I also found the supplied 500GB hard drive is a Seagate Momentus Thin ST500LT012 5400 RPM with 16MB Cache. 16MB HDD cache in an inexpensive laptop is an unexpected nice surprise. Every laptop in this price range I've seen have HDD's with 8mb cache. The extra drive cache will be a welcome little performance boost.

Reviews.Title: To be used in motorhome
Reviews.Author: wiyndog
Reviews.Content: I got this laptop for use as  a full-time RV'er.  It has Windows7!!!  I already increased the RAM to 8gb (the max).  I mainly use the computer for web browsing and record keeping; no games or video processing.  Everything on the computer has worked great, so far.  The built-in wifi is fast.  I don't use the touch pad, I have a trackball which I use on the right side, where I am constantly bumping into the headphone plug-in.  It would be nice to have some of the ports (USB, Mic, Headphones, etc) in the back and out of the way.  Overall a nice computer for a good price.

Reviews.Title: Excellent laptop
Reviews.Author: Warren D. Alcorn "Warren"
Reviews.Content: I purchased my Acer Aspire through Amazon for less than $500 and have no regrets, as it's well designed and even has a 'reader' slot for SD & other cards, to download photos, etc.  I chose this Acer with Windows 7 (Premium Home edition) as it's far easier to navigate than Windows 8!  I especially like the fact that it has LED backlighting for super sharp resolution.  I chose this brand after talking to some computer specialists who believes this is one of the more reliable laptops on the market.  So far so good, as I bought it early June.  If you have the room, pay a little more than a smaller screen and get the 17.3-inch screen, as it's awesome.

Reviews.Title: Windows 7 Easy Transfer with this Acer worked for me!
Reviews.Author: Susan Bame
Reviews.Content: My 7-year-old Sony Vaio laptop with Windows 7 needed to be replaced fast, and I bought this one several weeks ago.  I should also say that I own a MacBook Air, an iPad version 3, and an iPhone, and use all of them and take all of them to work with me on an almost-daily basis.  I created some databases with Microsoft programs on my Sony laptop, and try as I did, I couldn't figure out a good, efficient, quick and easy way to transfer the databases from the Sony to the Mac, unfortunately.  Buying the Acer was my solution.I transferred the files from the Sony to the Acer using the Windows 7 Easy Transfer program -- which wasn't all that Easy, but I figured it out.  What I learned about Easy Transfer was that I had to go in and actually make sure the files I wanted were checkmarked -- which included file folders with all my existing work-related Word documents, and my photos -- and then transferred using my high-speed wireless network.  It took a while, but it worked.  And, thanks to some advice from a computer-geek friend, the first thing I did before transferring any files was I uninstalled Microsoft Office Professional from my Sony computer and installed it on the Acer, then did Easy Transfer.  So now I have a nice big *working* computer that will last me a few more years while I figure out a better answer to the database and client-tracking quandary on my Mac.I have had no problems with the Acer, with the packaging, the battery, any of that -- that was all perfect.  Delivery with Amazon Prime was two days after I placed the order, which always amazes me.  The fact that I was able to set up the computer and get it running the way I want it, by myself, was also amazing.  This was a good choice for what I wanted and needed to keep my business going.I also bought a new case to go with the Acer:  B0029L5SQ4  This has room enough in it for the Acer cables and my iPad and bluetooth keyboard and all the cables &  to go with the iPad.It's great to be able to take my whole office with me when I'm going between home and the office, carrying my Acer, MacBook Air, iPad and iPhone in two bags.  I still prefer doing most of my work on my Mac -- I love the feel of the keyboard and the elegant design of the Mac, but most of the world I work with still uses Microsoft for everything, so I must use the Acer for that part of my life.  This was definitely a good purchase for me and I'd recommend it to others.  The Windows 7 Easy Transfer program was also a big plus.

Reviews.Title: Brilliant Display and it uses Windows 7
Reviews.Author: Diane
Reviews.Content: Good looking large format display (17") - loaded with Windows 7 which is a major plus with none of the Windows 8 stuff getting in the way. The wifi is amazing fast and Netflix is no problem and other downloads seem almost instantaneous.The keyboard is not as good as the equivalent Toshiba but very usable. The CD/DVD reader/writer works flawlessly and having 2 USB 3.0 ports and 2 USB 2.0 ports plus hdmi and svga makes for a very competent machine at the price.The intel chip is only a dual processor but unless you are doing heavy video editing it keeps up quite well.I added an extra 4Gb memory with no problem but with Windows 7 there have been few times that I have needed the extra RAM.The hard disk is plenty large enough and seems to work fast with few delays even when fetching 1+Gb video files.The machine comes pre-loaded with the usual irritants such as 30 day free trial of anti-virus software. So you will need to spend a little time removing these unless you intend to subscribe.Battery life is a bare 4 hrs on most of my early tests.Overall rating - brilliant laptop that is good substitute for a 'mobile' desktop.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Purchase
Reviews.Author: Darrell Marcum
Reviews.Content: I first purchased a couple for some employees. After handling them and seeing the performance and comfort, I decided to purchase 3 more. Now I am thinking about purchasing another for my son in college.

Reviews.Title: Bad Keyboard
Reviews.Author: R. Taormina
Reviews.Content: I agree with one of the previous reviewers,the keyboard is not good. If you don't hit the spacebar in the center it doesn't work. I'm not a fast typer and this really slows me down. I spend more time correcting than creating. I would NOT buy this machine again, it's really poor quality. I saved a few hundred bucks, but I've used that much in aggravation in two days. The service and delivery from Amazon was good.As a follow up,I just spoke with Acer support. After allowing them access to my machine for diagnosis, they claim it is a software problem which is not covered in the warranty.They offered me a software warranty for $400 for three years under which they could repair the problem. It was a pretty intense sales pitch. It feels like a physical problem to me, the keys, especially the space bar don't work properly.So, no help from Acer for my 2 day old machine! Maybe it's my imagination, but the machine seems worse after they got into it. I definetly will not deal with this company again

Reviews.Title: Pros and Cons
Reviews.Author: H&H Home Inspection
Reviews.Content: I purchased this laptop because of other reviews and also previous experience with Acer (I have owned another Acer laptop and liked it).  I really like the larger screen.  As my eyesight fades with age,it is very helpful to have.  The speed of the computer, etc. are all good, and it is a very nice looking product.Typing on it (uh, its main purpose) is not so easy.  Because of the larger area for the keyboard, I'm guessing, Acer chose to add a little extra space between the keys--and I am constantly hitting the incorrect key while typing.  The spacebar is extremely insensitive and does not respond very well (or at times it will add extra spaces).A slight touch anywhere near the touchpad can cause the computer to highlight typed text, and your next keystroke then erases everything typed--VERY frustrating!  I installed TouchFreeze in an effort to eliminate the cursor from jumping around and reiserting itself at a random place within my document, but that hasn't worked for this or the text-highlighting issue.  This could be a Microsoft problem, since I had this issue on other computers, too.Another frustrating problem I am experiencing is that I am constantly being disconnected from the Internet.  A friend mentioned wanting to check my DNS settings, but this sounded like a foreign language to me; I am not well-versed in "Computer-Ese."Overall, I would recommend Acer products, but probably not this specific model.  With the purchase of any computer, I would definitely recommend typing on it, getting the "feel" of it before purchasing.  Everyone is different, and as I've learned, the reviews of others do not mean that a product will meet my specific needs.

Reviews.Title: Good computer, but mouse drives me crazy
Reviews.Author: Lisa Marie Piper
Reviews.Content: I like the computer well enough, but the mouse pad drives me insane.  A hair or a breath over the pad moves your cursor all over the place.  Tried all the settings I could to make it ease up, but to no avail.

Reviews.Title: Great computer with no issues.
Reviews.Author: CJMeier
Reviews.Content: Great laptop for the price. I use it for work everyday and it is able to run all of my apicaio s without issue. Easy to operate, reliable, and a great value. I replace computers about every five years because the cost of repairs. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Acer Aspire
Reviews.Author: R. J. Gutt "Tigercat"
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty nice laptop. I love the keyboard and large screen. Just like my Acer from 25 years ago, most everything is integrated and not upgradeable, especially the intel graphics. Some programs will not run with the intel graphics. Still, I really love the laptop. The screen is very nice, and the wireless works very well.EDIT: The DVD drive broke the second week, ugh.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: rindy
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my dad so he could surf the web and word process.  So far it has held up well 3 months in.  No complaints.

Reviews.Title: Mixipick's Pick #3
Reviews.Author: Mixipick
Reviews.Content: It has done everything I need it to do. There is plenty of RAM and I really like the large monitor. AMAZON provided it at a great price and delivery was fast. That's it. I'm done.

Reviews.Title: its such worth the money
Reviews.Author: jordan wison
Reviews.Content: this computer is the best!!!!It can display movies with out even dowloading any sowftware. im using it right know and its the best! bye this computer its so worth the money!

Reviews.Title: User Friendly
Reviews.Author: Krule1
Reviews.Content: Was looking for a lap top that had Windows 7. This fit the bill.  Good price for the equipment it is built with.

Reviews.Title: GREAT VALUE
Reviews.Author: Guy H. Firor "CAPT GUY FIROR"
Reviews.Content: THIS IS MY THIRD ACER AND WONT BE MY LAST. EASY SETUP, BIG SCREEN, GREAT RESOLUTION, WINDOWS 7- A MUST!!THE ASPIRE SERIES IS ONE OF THE BEST VALUES ON THE MARKET.

Reviews.Title: DVD Burner doesnt work
Reviews.Author: T Rubbins
Reviews.Content: I bought this computer and had it less than 6 months and the DVD burner and drive no longer work.

Reviews.Title: decent for the price
Reviews.Author: Steven Bush
Reviews.Content: System hangs a lot.  Some times just reboots. Key board is somewhat awkward and space bar really needs to be hit square on in order for it to work

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: David Peters "avid collector"
Reviews.Content: I got my new ACER computer and I love it. The 17 inch screen is perfect and the clarity is amazing. This is my first laptop ever and it's nice to be able to take it with me wherever I go.  I would recommend this computer to anyone. The Windows 7 is still the best out there. glad I was able to get that.

Reviews.Title: PC Laptop
Reviews.Author: Marie
Reviews.Content: I ordered this computer for working from home. I love how big the screen is and how comfortable it is to use the computer. The specs on this computer are exactly what the company I work for requires, so I am satisfied with my purchase. Windows 7 is much better than Windows 8 in my opinion, which was another reason why I selected this laptop. Finally, I really like all the support and easy communication Acer offers when you buy one of their products. Great buy.

Reviews.Title: Acer Aspire 17.3 inch laptop
Reviews.Author: Jeannine
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a great computer.  I needed it for school and it has been a best friend to me.  No faults, just a perfect little computer and the perfect size.  Awesome.

Reviews.Title: Acer Aspire NX.M34AA.005;ASV3-731-4634 17.3-Inch Laptop
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: A good low end laptop, well worth the money with its large screen and good memory plus I wanted a replacement with windows 7 and this fitted the bill, only down size to date is the sound is a bit on the tinny side.AGG

Reviews.Title: Bought this for the wife
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: Other than having to teach the wife about the changes in the OS, this laptop was a great deal. So far it's been running like a champ.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop
Reviews.Author: Jim Morgan
Reviews.Content: This is my third laptop and the best one yet. I have no complaints. Does everything that I want it to do. I love the bigger screen.

Reviews.Title: This is my 3rd acer
Reviews.Author: LaunaKae
Reviews.Content: I love acer computers...My only disappointment is that I found this exact computer cheaper 3 days after I received it...At Wal-Mart of all places...I will definitely do my homework before buying again....

Reviews.Title: It's a decent size
Reviews.Author: Quiet
Reviews.Content: but it doesn't come with much and the keys really are a little stiff (this from someone who usually finds the type getting away from her). However, the screen is a great size and it would be hard to beat the price. I hesitate to say more because I don't want to give it any excuses to work less well than it has been.

Reviews.Title: Great Old-School Laptop
Reviews.Author: Sax Lover
Reviews.Content: Like other reviews have mentioned, it's a big, heavy unit - old-school, compared with I-Pad mini's & newer laptops - but it does have good spec's on many counts.  I'm a musician; so I appreciate the built-in speakers, even if they need a tweak on the playback EQ.  The DVD playback has good resolution, with sufficient RAM (plus add-on memory capability; I haven't even needed to try that yet).  Internet is fast too.  Windows 7 OS is okay, but I do miss the 'manual override' that the older OS's still permitted - so Microsoft sells us another OS every few years, always touting its correction & perfection (a lesson learned from Apple).  I prefer the older OS's, but they are rendered obsolete after a time & we are again forced to update (not necessarily upgrade!), even though it kills functionality of older favorite software programs.  Grrr!  But the Acer laptop is good for what it is, lacking software that they want you to buy & add on, still a good buy for a good-bye to older, clunkier portable electronic devices.

Reviews.Title: Easy for my 88 year old father to use
Reviews.Author: B. Huppertz "Weight Watcher"
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my father who is 88 andwanted a laptop.  Thought he might have trouble learning Windows 8 so I was glad to find this nice, new laptop that still had Windows 7.  The price was great, too.

Reviews.Title: Acer Laptop is the TOPS
Reviews.Author: Marc
Reviews.Content: My husband originally bought and I loved it so much after he purchased it, I bought one for my self.  The reason we love it, it has Windows 7 which you cannot find in the stores anymore when purchasing a laptop.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: LORI AHRENS
Reviews.Content: Like the Acer. Never had a Laptop before but I am enjoying this one. Like all the features offer on this Acer.

Reviews.Title: Very good laptop for the money.
Reviews.Author: Ted Chris
Reviews.Content: Very easy to install. Not quite as fast as I thought it would be on start up each day but after that speed is fine. Had to call tech rep once and she was very rude so I eventually hung up on her and figured it out myself. Plenty of memory for me and can be expanded to 8 GB if needed.

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop for the price
Reviews.Author: Paul Andrew Lees Jr.
Reviews.Content: Exactly what I needed. Didn't want to deal with Windows 8. Great machine. Quite, fast and not loaded with allot of other manufacturer applications.

Reviews.Title: Bought as a Gift for a Friend
Reviews.Author: Kelly Christesson
Reviews.Content: I bought this computer as a gift for my friend who is in school He is so Happy with this Laptop he said it is really going to help him wiith his studies

Reviews.Title: Very nice laptop.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is the best laptop I have ever used. It has a very nice, large screen with great graphics. Was also very reasonibly priced. You will be very pleased with this product.

Reviews.Title: everything ok so far
Reviews.Author: steilkie
Reviews.Content: laptop is rolling right along, does all i need it to do, lightning fast. hopefully it will last for a few years, still using my old laptop so this one is kinda used part time.

Reviews.Title: Good laptop, but a few sticky keys
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer "unicdreams"
Reviews.Content: I like the size and number of USB ports.  A few of the keys seem sticky.  Otherwise  it functions well.

Reviews.Title: Satisfying purchase
Reviews.Author: cf100
Reviews.Content: First laptop, purchased used but was in excellent condition. Have only had for a couple of weeks but so far have no complaints. Quick response, not too sure about battery charge life yet but since this is for work and will be used plugged in most of the time, I'm not expecting that to be a big problem. The Windows 7 was a big selling point after all the 'horror' stories I've been reading about Windows 8. Have Windows 7 at home and have no complaints about it so looked for it for work for consistency sake. All in all, I'm happy with the purchase so far.

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT
Reviews.Author: D. Hunter
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice laptop.  Quick starting and solid construction.  Keyboard is very tactile and easy to type on.  Screen is bright and crisp.  It is a pleasure to work on this computer.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value
Reviews.Author: Lana
Reviews.Content: We use a laptop at home for e-mail and web-search; this model does that, and a lot more, beautifully.  The unit is well made, looks and feels good.  I have two reservations; it does not have a back-lit keyboard and the key pad is too far to the back for my comfort ( the keyboard location allows for a large & comfortable touch-pad but I prefer & use a cordless mouse.)

Reviews.Title: I LOVE IT!!!
Reviews.Author: charles r garcia
Reviews.Content: ITS A GREAT BUY !!! I GOT IT FOR MY SON CALVIN AND HE IS THE ONE USING IT, HER JUST LOVE IT!!!

Reviews.Title: Pretty good
Reviews.Author: JAckie Revoir
Reviews.Content: It isn't as fast as I thought it would be, but I am still breaking it in.  I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Solid laptop, good price
Reviews.Author: Carmine Bello
Reviews.Content: I spent several weeks searching for a new laptop and was trying to avoid Windows8.  This Acer system not only comes with Windows7 64-bit, but has everything I was looking for.Sure, the Intel B960 processor isn't top of the line, but it still delivers solid performance.Ya gotta love the 17.3 HD screen!

Reviews.Title: Great computer
Reviews.Author: Sally Hernandez
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a 17" laptop for my husband.  This is the only one I could find that was loaded with Windows 7.  It was a fluke that it was the same model that I bought myself a year ago for $300 more.  Great buy and it came fast

Reviews.Title: Love my new Acer
Reviews.Author: Kat
Reviews.Content: Love my new Acer. The only thing I don't like is the sensitivity of the touch pad. Can't figure out how to change that.

Reviews.Title: Kid friendly
Reviews.Author: misty fusco
Reviews.Content: Good good, not computer literate but becoming so , after purchase! Would highly recommend this to anyone especially for the price!

Reviews.Title: Excellent quality & value
Reviews.Author: Tsen Chow
Reviews.Content: Love the size and brightness of the screen. Coupled with the relatively low price, this is an unbeatable combination. The color scheme of this laptop is very attractive.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: Robert G.
Reviews.Content: I have been getting hours of good use out  of this laptop, since I got it two months ago.  I like the bigger screen for photo processing. The only tricky part has been the touch pad is sensitive and I sometimes accidentally hit it with the heel of my hand while typing, which moves can move the insert point to a different spot. So I often use a wireless mouse and turn off the touch pad. Other than that it has worked really well.

Reviews.Title: Needed a Win 7 laptop for work - love it
Reviews.Author: Matthew Dobeck "Matt"
Reviews.Content: I work from home and needed a Windows 7 machine.  This was a great deal - nice sized screen - have had no problems whatsoever.
